* Signals that the {@code add} command input is invalid and the expense
* Creates an exception that describes why parsing failed.
* @param message human-readable explanation of the failure
* Creates an exception that wraps a lower-level cause encountered while parsing.
* @param message contextual information about the failure
* Represents an exception thrown when a delete command cannot be parsed or executed properly.
* This exception is used in {@link ExpenseManager} when:

*
  • The delete command input is missing an index.

*
  • The provided index is not a valid integer.

*
  • The index is less than 1 or exceeds the number of expenses in the list.
* Constructs a new DeleteCommandException with the specified detail message.
* @param message the detail message describing the error
* Constructs a new DeleteCommandException with the specified detail message and cause.
* @param message the detail message describing the error
* @param cause   the cause of this exception (which can be retrieved later using {@link #getCause()})
* Represents an exception thrown when a mark or unmark command cannot be parsed or executed properly.
* This exception is used in {@link ExpenseManager} when:

*
  • The mark/unmark command input is missing an index.

*
  • The provided index is not a valid integer.

*
  • The index is less than 1 or exceeds the number of expenses in the list.
* Constructs a new MarkUnmarkCommandException with the specified detail message.
* @param message the detail message describing the error
* Constructs a new MarkUnmarkCommandException with the specified detail message and cause.
* @param message the detail message describing the error
* @param cause   the cause of this exception (which can be retrieved later using {@link #getCause()})
* Custom exception class for orCASHbuddy application-specific errors.
* Provides factory methods for creating common exception types with appropriate messages.

return new OrCashBuddyException("Expense index must be an integer", cause);
* Creates an exception for expense index less than 1.
return new OrCashBuddyException("Expense index must be at least 1");

* Handles user interactions such as displaying messages.
* Prints the main menu of available commands.
System.out.println("Add an expense:                        add a/AMOUNT desc/DESCRIPTION [cat/CATEGORY]");
System.out.println("Mark an expense as paid:               mark EXPENSE_INDEX");
System.out.println("Mark an expense as unpaid:             unmark EXPENSE_INDEX");
System.out.println("Sort all expenses in descending order: sort");
System.out.println("Bye. Hope to see you again soon!");
